sentence.text: cation transport is needed by brain metastatic cells from breast cancer (MDA-MB-231-BrM2) to probe their physical environment as they anchor and pull on their surroundings or when confronted with confined migration through narrow pores.

Consequently, hallmarks of cancer invasion and metastasis related to regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton, actin cytoskeleton, and/or force transmission, such as migration, extracellular matrix degradation, and Serpin B2 secretion, were reduced in cells lacking Piezo2

entity.text: regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton
